question: Two thin long parallel wires separated by a distance 'r' from each other in vacuum carry a current of I ampere in opposite directions. Then, they will
choices: Attract each other with a force per unit length of <katex>$\frac{\mu_0 I^2}{2\pi r}$</katex>
Repel each other with a force per unit length of <katex>$\frac{\mu_0 I^2}{2\pi r}$</katex>
Repel each other with a force per unit length of <katex>$\frac{\mu_0 I^2}{2\pi r^2}$</katex>
Attract each other with a force per unit length of <katex>$\frac{\mu_0 I^2}{2\pi r^2}$</katex>
explanation: Force per unit length <katex>$\frac{F}{l} = \frac{\mu_0 I_1 I_2}{2\pi r} = \frac{\mu_0 I^2}{2\pi r}$</katex>.
Parallel currents attract; Anti-parallel (opposite direction) currents repel.
